addresses.description: A list of IP addresses used for the reservation.

ddns_hostname.description: Dynamic DNS hostname for the reservation. Only applicable for ISC DHCP servers.

description.description: Description for the reservation. Only applicable for MS DHCP servers.

filename.description: The filename DHCP option. Only applicable for ISC DHCP servers.

name.description: The name of DHCP reservation you want to query.

next_server.description: The next-server ISC DHCP option. Only applicable for ISC DHCP servers.

owner.description: DHCP group scope or server where this reservation is made.

owner_ref.description: Internal reference to the DHCP group scope or server where this reservation is made.

ref.description: Internal reference to this DHCP reservation

reservation_method.description: DHCP reservation method. Example: HardwareAddress , ClientIdentifier. (Default: HardwareAddress)

servername.description: The server-name DHCP option. Only applicable for ISC DHCP servers.

type.description: The type of this DHCP reservation. Example: DHCP , BOOTP , BOTH.

aging.description: The aging timestamp of dynamic records in AD integrated zones. Hours since January 1, 1601, UTC. Providing a non-zero value creates a dynamic record.

comment.description: Contains the comment string for the record. Only records in static DNS zones can have a comment string. Some cloud DNS provides do not support comments.

data.description: The data stored in the DNS record.

dns_zone_ref.description: Internal reference to the zone where this DNS record is stored.

enabled.description: If the DNS record is enabled. (Default: True)

ref.description: Internal reference to this DNS record.

server.description: The DNS server where the DNS record is stored. Requires FQDN with the trialing dot '.'.

ttl.description: The DNS record's Time To Live value in seconds, setting how long the record is allowed to be cached.

type.description: The DNS recod type. Accepted types: A, AAAA, CNAME, DNAME, DLV, DNSKEY, DS, HINFO, LOC, MX, NAPTR, NS, NSEC3PARAM, PTR, RP, SOA, SPF, SRV, SSHFP, TLSA, TXT. (Default: A)

view.description: The view of the DNS record. Example: internal.

zone.description: The DNS zone where the record is stored. Requires FQDN with the trailing dot '.'.

adintegrated.description: If the DNS zone is AD integrated. (Default: False)

adpartition.description: The AD partition if the zone is AD integrated.

adreplicationtype.description: Replication type if the zone is AD integrated.

authority.description: The authoritative DNS server for this zone. Requires FQDN with the trailing dot '.'.

created.description: DDate when zone was created in Micetro.

custom_properties.description: Map of custom properties associated with this DNS zone.

displayname.description: A display name to distinguish the zone from other, identically named zone instances.

dnsviewrefs.description: Interal references to views. Only used with Active Directory.

dynamic.description: If the DNS zone is dynamic. (Default: False)

kskids.description: A comma-separated string of IDs of KSKs. Starting with active keys, then inactive keys in parenthesis.

lastmodified.description: Date when zone was last modified in Micetro.

masters.description: List of IP addresses of all master zones, for slave zones.

name.description: Fully qualified name of DNS zone, ending with the trailing dot '.'.

ref.description: Internal references to this DNS zone.

type.description: The type of the DNS zone. Example: Master, Slave, Hint, Stub, Forward. (Default: Master)

view.description: Name of the view this DNS zone is in.

zskids.description: A comma-separated string of IDs of ZSKs. Starting with active keys, then inactive keys in parenthesis.

claimed.description: If address should be claimed. Default: true

custom_properties.description: Map of custom properties associated with this IP address. You can only assign properties that are already defined in Micetro.

device.description: The device associated with the object.

discovery_type.description: The discovery method of the IP address. Example: None, Ping, ARP, Lease, Custom.

extraneous_ptr.description: 'True' if there are extraneous PTR records for the object.

interface.description: The interface associated with the object.

last_discovery_date.description: The date when the system last performed IP address discovery for this IP address.

last_known_client_identifier.description: The last known MAC address associated with the IP address discovery information.

last_seen_date.description: The date when the address was last seen during IP address discovery.

ptr_status.description: PTR record status. Example: Unknown, OK, Verify.

ref.description: Internal reference for the IP address.

state.description: The state of the IP address. Example: Free, Assigned, Claimed, Pending, Held.

exclude_dhcp.description: Exclude IP addresses that are assigned via DHCP

ping.description: Verify IP address is free with ping

range.description: Pick IP address from range with name

start_at.description: Start searching for IP address from

temporary_claim_time.description: Time in seconds to temporarily claim IP address, so it isn't claimed by others while the claim is in progess.

block.description: Find a free IP address to claim.

addresses.description: A list of IP addresses used for the reservation.

ddns_hostname.description: Dynamic DNS host name for the reservation. Only applicable for ISC DHCP servers.

description.description: Description for the reservation. Only applicable for MS DHCP servers.

filename.description: The filename DHCP option. Only applicable for ISC DHCP servers.

name.description: The name of the DHCP reservation you want to query.

next_server.description: The next-server ISC DHCP option. Only applicable for ISC DHCP servers.

owner_ref.description: Internal reference to the DHCP group scope or server where this reservation is made.

ref.description: Internal reference to this DHCP reservation.

reservation_method.description: DHCP reservation method, Example: HardwareAddress , ClientIdentifier.

servername.description: The server-name DHCP option. Only applicable for ISC DHCP servers.

type.description: The type of this DHCP reservation. Example: DHCP , BOOTP , BOTH.

available.description: Number of available addresses in the address pool(s) of the scope.

description.description: A description for the DHCP scope.

dhcp_server.description: The DHCP server of this scope.

name.description: The name of the DHCP scope you want to query.

ref.description: Internal reference to this DHCP reservation.

superscope.description: The name of the superscope for the DHCP scope. Only applicable for MS DHCP servers.

aging.description: The aging timestamp of dynamic records in AD integrated zones. Hours since January 1, 1601, UTC. Providing a non-zero value creates a dynamic record.

comment.description: Contains the comment string for the record. Only records in static DNS zones can have a comment string. Some cloud DNS provides do not support comments.

data.description: The data stored in the record

dns_zone_ref.description: Internal reference to the zone where this DNS record is stored.

enabled.description: If the DNS record is enabled.

ref.description: Internal reference to this DNS record.

server.description: The DNS server where the DNS record is stored.

ttl.description: The DNS record's Time To Live value in seconds, setting how long the record is allowed to be cached.

type.description: The DNS record type. Example: CNAME.

view.description: The view of the DNS record. Example: internal.

zone.description: The DNS zone where the record is stored.

adintegrated.description: If the DNS zone is AD integrated.

authority.description: The authoritative DNS server for this zone.

created.description: Date when zone was created in Micetro.

customp_properties.description: Map of custom properties associated with this DNS zone.

displayname.description: A display name to distinguish the zone from other, identically named zone instances.

dnsviewrefs.description: Interal references to views. Only used with Active Directory.

dynamic.description: If the DNS zone is dynamic.

kskids.description: A comma-separated string of IDs of KSKs. Starting with active keys, then inactive keys in parenthesis.

lastmodified.description: Date when zone was last modified in Micetro.

name.description: Fully qualified name of DNS zone, ending with the trailing dot '.'.

ref.description: Internal references to this DNS zone.

server.description: Fully qualified name of the DNS server where the record is stored, ending with the trailing dot '.'.

type.description: The type of the DNS zone. Example: Master, Slave, Hint, Stub, Forward.

view.description: Name of the view this DNS zone is in.

zskids.description: A comma-separated string of IDs of ZSKs. Starting with active keys, then inactive keys in parenthesis.

claimed.description: If the IP address is claimed.

custom_properties.description: Map of custom properties associated with this IP address.

device.description: The device associated with the object.

discovery_type.description: The discovery method of the IP address. Example: None, Ping, ARP, Lease, Custom.

extraneous_ptr.description: 'True' if there are extraneous PTR records for the object.

hold_info.description: Contains information about who holds the otherwise free IP, and for how long.

interface.description: The interface associated with the object.

last_discovery_date.description: The date when the system last performed IP address discovery for this IP address.

last_known_client_identifier.description: The last known MAC address associated with the IP address discovery information.

last_seen_date.description: The date when the address was last seen during IP address discovery.

ptr_status.description: PTR record status. Example: Unknown, OK, Verify.

ref.description: Internal reference for the IP address.

state.description: The state of the IP address. Example: Free, Assigned, Claimed, Pending, Held.
